Article.Abstract: Localization of human MHC class I-restricted T cell epitopes in the circumsporozoite (CS) protein of the human parasite Plasmodium falciparum is an important objective in the development of antimalarial vaccines. To this purpose, we synthesized a series of overlapping synthetic 20-mer peptides, spanning the entire sequence of the 7G8 CS molecule except for the central repeat B cell domain. The P.f.CS peptides were first tested for their ability to bind to the human MHC class I HLA-A2.1 molecule on T2, a human cell line. Subsequently, the use of a series of shorter peptide analogues allowed us to determine the optimal A2.1 binding sequence present in several of the 20-mers. Binding P.f.CS peptides were further tested for their capacity to activate PBL from HLA-A2.1+ immune donors living in a malaria-endemic area. Specific IFN-gamma production was detected in the supernatant of cultures of PBL from exposed individuals. Cytotoxic T cell lines and clones were derived from the PBL of one responder, and their activity was shown to be HLA-A2.1-restricted and specific for the peptide 334-342 of the CS protein. In addition, double transgenic HLA-A2.1 x human beta 2-microglobulin mice were immunized with peptide 1-10 of the CS protein. T cells derived from immune lymph nodes displayed a peptide-specific HLA-A2.1-restricted cytolytic activity after one in vitro stimulation.
Article.ArticleTitle: Localization of HLA-A2.1-restricted T cell epitopes in the circumsporozoite protein of Plasmodium falciparum.
Article.Affiliations: Institute of Biochemistry, University of Lausanne, Epalinges, Switzerland.

Article.Comments: Data originally imported from the Database of Functional Molecular Immunology, FIMM (http://sdmc.lit.org.sg:8080/fimm/) and from the HLA Ligand Database (http://hlaligand.ouhsc.edu/)

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide-stimulated cultures were considered positive when the concentration of IFNγ was greater than the mean +3 SD of that obtained from control cultures where no peptide was added.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Peptides P.f.CS 1-10 and tetanus toxin p30 were mixed and emulsified in IFA to inject the mice at the base of the tail. .

AssayInformation.AssayComments: T cells were analyzed 10 days after in vitro restimulation.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Peptides P.f.CS 1-10 and tetanus toxin p30 were mixed and emulsified in IFA to inject the mice at the base of the tail. .

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The assay was done 10 days after inmunization.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The T cell line was generated after two rounds of in vitro stimulation with the peptide.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lines 1.2, 1.3 and 1.12, derived by limiting dilution from the T cell line A3/7G8, also showed CTL activity with the peptide.
